Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Samantha F
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very high quality service, the staff were very polite and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was amazing! one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in, it made our holiday! thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A hundred thanks!”
Reviews.Author: FerreOn
Reviews.Content: Sweet, tranquil and clean looking rooms at very affordable rates! 3 mins walk to the main Terminal where u need to get around in trains or buses for tours or luggage reasons. Great for tourist and lovers. Hotel service is very personal as it only has about 20 over rooms to manage!

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: martind3r
Reviews.Content: I'm rating the Hotel Marghera 5 star, not because it's a "5 star" hotel, but because it's a "5 star" experience in a 3 star hotel. The room is a nice size, is clean, and has a small refrigerator. The shower was small, but then all of the shower stalls we saw in Italy were small! The breakfast provided was excellent (at least a 20 Euro). To go a little further, it's an easy 5 to 8 minute walk from the exit at the termi station. Personnel is great, and will let you leave your suitcases there if you arrive before their 2 p.m. check-in. The Metro station is really convenient to the hotel, also the buses are right there infront of the station. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CaptAzfar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marghera Hotel Rome for 2 nights. A really nice hotel located VERY near to Roma Termini Station. very cnvinient . rooms were amazing got the newly refurbished room cause it wuz alot nicer than those in the pics. And to muslims, there r quite a number of Halal Bangladeshi restaurants in the area. Definitely will stay here again on my next trip to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: mar1a4oD
Reviews.Content: Booked online from official website, confirmed by the phone: very helpfull staff. Web site pics worth of trust. Confortable, clean and nice decorated rooms (we had double) aircon, wi-fi internet access. Personnel kind and helpful for every needs. Buffet breakfast (7.30 to 9.30 am). Good location: 20 mins away from Coliseum or Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: durb4m1G
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation in a hotel across the street from Hotel Marghera and they did not have a room for us so, they tried to put us up in a hostel. We refused and ended up stopping in the Hotel Marghera. Antonio, the owner, was extremely hospitable and gave us a good rate for 3 nights! The hotel is a cozy boutique style and the owners are very proud of their services. The decor was sweet, the rooms were not spacious but adequate for 2 people, they had nice cool airconditioning and a beautiful breakfast room! The staff was very friendly and made our stay a very positive one! This is truly a hotel and not a pension pretending to be a hotel. The decor and hospitality was wonderful! It's located a block from the train station and access to the entire city of Rome is very easy. We did not have to use a taxi once during our stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “super super! familiäre und freundliche”
Reviews.Author: marcus30TH
Reviews.Content: Sehr familiäre und freundliche Atmosphäre. Überraschend sauber. Keine Komplikationen. Sehr gute Lage, um Stadttouren zu Fuß oder per ÖNVP zu starten, da es sich direkt an der Altstadt befindet. In der Nähe befindet Bahnhof Termini. Im Wohnblock gibt es einige gute und günstige Gelegenheiten zum Essen.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: lara09m
Reviews.Content: Very well located close to the centre of Rome with almost every place of interest within a comfortable walking distance. Termini Station are only a few minutes walk . The room price included breakfast classed as buffet and included croissants, cakes, fresh rolls, boiled eggs, ham & salami, cheese and jam. Plenty of food and served with juice and coffee. Good wireless internet connection in the room. Room was clean if a little small and beds were very comfortable. Nice bathroom with bidet. Staff very helpful. Double glazed windows so very quiet and qood curtains kept out the light. Definately would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old iritating Owner!!”
Reviews.Author: Ave_grey
Reviews.Content: We settled on this hotel for 3 nights. And this old lady Who i found out is the Owner is always yelling on her worker.. It's always like that.. And one time me and my husband taking a nap when we heard a loud voice And its her.. And i said to my husband godness i thought there's a fire! Even the other lady we saw them shouting at each other. Ang i thought i rent a room to have some rest after a day out but what do we get? So terible! And not to' mention the chairs has many many stains curtains that i think that heve'nt washEd for years. God its already black! And one time we saw a dog footprint on our table napkin. And my husband told me that's it let's transfer to onother hotel. An advice to all who's planning to prenotate on this hotel if want to have the wonderful stay in rome don't stay on that awful place!

Reviews.Title: “Very negative experience”
Reviews.Author: Monika M
Reviews.Content: We arrived yesterday from Rome and had really bad experience with this hotel. We were 6 persons in 2 rooms. One of the rooms was a total disaster, nothing worked properly in the bathroom: broken toilet seat, water flows from shower directly on the floor etc. Lamps inside the room and on the balcony not working, fridge not working. Balcony is full messy and dirty like a storage room. I asked the manager to repair these but nothing happened. The washroom was next to our room, that means noise, singing and chatting from 6 am. The worst part: money was missing one afternoon, I mentioned it the manager, he got angry and said he can't believe it. I said the feeling is mutual... And he never told us a "sorry" or something like that. I do not recommend this place for anybody.

Reviews.Title: “a plesant hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyluca
Reviews.Content: Thank you all at The Marghera for helping to make our stay in Rome so enjoyable. You have a most pleasant hotel and a very warm welcome particularly from our four legged friend in reception ! Standards of cleanliness were worthy of note and hotel location extremely convenient. Maybe tea/coffee facilities in rooms could have further improved our experience though overall most satisfactory. Many thanks again, Ciao !!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet surprise in the midst of small train station hotels”
Reviews.Author: swift75
Reviews.Content: We are three American women who extended our Tuscany vacation with two nights in Rome. Walking over from Termini Station, we did not know what to expect. This is in some ways a typical European lower cost hotel- tiny lobby, elevator fits one person with suitcases, very small room. However, this hotel is a cut above. The front desk staff are Italian, knowledgeable about the city, speak passable English, sincere and helpful. The entire place is spotless, tastefully decorated, and best of all the rooms and beds are comfortable. One thing that was very much appreciated was the fantastic water pressure and endless hot water in the shower( great at the end of a long day of sightseeing).The breakfast had quite a variety of good food. The only thing which could be improved on is the wi fi internet service. It is expensive and spotty. In this day and age, it should be reliable and free.All in all, I recommend this hotel to tourists who want a safe clean comfortable hotel close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a review.”
Reviews.Author: shori
Reviews.Content: I would like to reserve this hotel for October 2011 and the hotel site won't allow me. I think it's because it's too far ahead. Neither I could submit this letter through the hotel site. I am planning to stay in this hotel based on responses of Mr. Eduard Ghergheluca to reviews on Tripadvisor. His responses made me think that hotel staff really cares about their guests and are commited to improve their serivces. With this being said, I respectully ask if someone from the hotel staff could contact me so I can make my reservation now. My emial: shori7@hotmail.com Thank you in advance, Shorena

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Martincad
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located for bars and restaurants and of course the transport hub at Termini station. An unpretentious,modest hotel with a warm welcome representing good value for money in a city centre area.Cleanliness was excellent and rooms serviced daily to a good standard. Staff courteous and efficient and breakfast though basic was well presented. A very pleasant break helped to no small measure by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: iconapoint
Reviews.Content: Our one week stay at Hotel Marghera was pleasant and enjoyable and we will stay there again when visiting Rome. The hotel is family-owned and run [father, mother and daughter (Pierangela)] with a very friendly and accommodating atmosphere. In addition, the three most oustanding aspects of the hotel are: 1. Its proximity to Termini Station [less 50 metres] which is the transport hub for trains, metro and buses - making it very easy to access all the main sites of Rome and to/from the airports. Termini also has the best self-service restaurant with a daily variety of traditional Italian dishes. 2. While most tourist hotel rooms in Rome are generally small and old, all the rooms in the Marghera have just been renovated. Depending on your budget some rooms are larger than others. 3. The area is very quiet at night and after an exhausting day of sightseeing in very loud Roman traffic, its nice to return to a nice quiet room. Aigul & Anthony

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - feedback from 2 girls from England Dec 2010”
Reviews.Author: StefaniaMaccaglia
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend arrived at the hotel without a reservation and were greated very warmly and professionally from the Manager. We were given a lovely room on the 4th floor which had a double bed, two balconies. All lovely Christmas decorations throughout the hotel. We thought this place was fantastic, especially considering the price. The breakfast was just right, and it was included in the price. I would definitely stay here again when I come back to Rome when visiting friends and family (especially when the owner promised a discount! - hopefully he'll remember) Thanks for your kindness and we definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: andrewcs
Reviews.Content: This hotel received mixed reviews, so i was a little bit concerned before our 3 night stay. However, i had absolutely nothing to worry about. The hotel itself was very clean , the room was tidy and made up every day. The staff were very helpful and friendly and couldn't have done more for us.The hotel is located 5 minutes walk form termini station, from which you access any area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sanda-Mth4
Reviews.Content: Closely from Roma Termini Station and easy to find. The service and room was good. I haven't seen any problems during my travel.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: tonykru
Reviews.Content: My family and i had a very good experienced in our stay in hotel marghera, via marghera, rome. we can did our late check in (around 10pm) easily, a very friendly officer welcoming us warmly, giving us a very comfortable situation at the moment. the location also is a very good point, near Roma Termini, so we can arranged our trip in Rome enjoyfully.... thanks to Marghera!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Located Near the Termini”
Reviews.Author: NYCBX1
Reviews.Content: The Marghera has well appointed rooms located within walking distance of the Termini Rail Station (literally a 2 minute walk). Our room was lovely with a canopied bed that my daughters shared and a single one for me. Very Laura Ashley in decor. Our bathroom was big with 2 sinks. Normally hotels located near rail stations can be a bit seedy but not the Marghera. They also offer a wonderful breakfast each morning. Our stay was only 2 days so the convenience of being near the Termini was helpul.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel! Ever!”
Reviews.Author: muncherama
Reviews.Content: As soon as we set foot in the hotel, there was a customer running downstairs to the counter to complain about the room was unacceptable. We knew it was not a good sign. We chose the place because of its closeness to the Roma Termini. Other than that, it was a total dive. Everything was broken in this hotel. Light switches in the room were broken, toilet seat was broken, no shower curtain, dirty carpet, tiles almost fallen... This hotel needs some major repairs. For the 140 Euro we paid, that's a complete ripped off. They claimed to be a 3 star hotel, but it should not qualify for any star. The pictures on the website is totally deceiving. I would not recommend anyone to stay there. Period.

Reviews.Title: “just passing thru Rome single lady”
Reviews.Author: martytoronto
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel without a reservation and I was greated warmly and professionally by the owner and by Mauricio (hope I have his name correct) was given a lovely room on the 4th floor which had a double very comfortable bed and very quiet although is just not even 2 blocks from the termini train station. I had a family emergency at home and was in transit with hopes of changing my flights they were kind and most understanding. breakfast was very elegant !! however if you need internet is not included and is $5 E per hour but that did not matter to me since the service and comfort for a 3 star hotel made it up .. all lovely decorations but changing the carpet in the elevator will make a big difference since is what you see first.. Is all updated why not change the old dirty carpet !! They have 2 lovely dogs that will also welcome you if you like dogs.. they will know !! thanks for your kindness and I do recommend this hotel.. but I dont recommend going to Rome in August.. avoid it if you can. hop on- off tour buses in rome.. beware dont use 110open is terrible non of the audio works and their staff is not very friendly !! pay a bit more a go with others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Dokodemoguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for 2 days during our Italy round trip in April/May. I read about the guest reviews beforehand but I must disagree with some of them. The Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. No communication problems at all. The room was small but relaxing. No much noise from the street and that so close to the station. A rich and delicious breakfast in a fancy tearoom was a great start into the day. The only thing which I wasn't so pleased about was the Hotel Elevator. Ok, sometimes it worked and the other minute not. That's troublesome if your room is on the top floor and you have heavy luggage. Well, they managed it somehow to fix it in time. If we have a chance to visit Rome again, we might choose this small Hotel a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Travellers beware!”
Reviews.Author: Oztraveller22
Reviews.Content: As our first experience with hotels in Italy, this one was quite worrying. We had a similar experience to other travellers in being charged the room rate to our credit card while our preference for cash payment was refused with the excuse that "this is the way it is in all hotels". Not the case at all we discovered -their deceiptfulness stuck in our mind. At least we didn't pay in cash AND by card as others seem to have done. Wonder how many travellers failed to realise they had been dudded - have to wonder about the ethics of this hotel. The room was basically OK if a little scuffed and the services worked well. Can't comment on breakfast as we were up too early for them. Overall we would advise travellers to give this one a miss. A decidedly sleazy feel about the place and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “A lesson to be learnt!”
Reviews.Author: scazza
Reviews.Content: If you are considering booking this hotel PLEASE be careful as you will be asked, like most hotels, to hold the booking with your credit card details. Our experience was that on the second day of our stay they took payment from our credit card without our knowledge and then asked to pay in cash on departure (by prior e-mail) which we did. Manager on reception did not count the cash but merely put it under the desk and at the time I thought, that is very trusting of her, not knowing that they had taken payment already!! On return from Rome we then realised we had paid twice and trying to get our money back was a nightmare. The hotel did not respond to e-mails nor and just put the phone down when we tried to call denying all knowledge. After one month with the help of the booking agent and almost daily 'phone calls liaising with the agent we managed get our refund of £800. The breakfast was also disappointing if you are not early birds you will not catch the worm (they run of of bread)!

Reviews.Title: “houston lady”
Reviews.Author: houstonkiwilime
Reviews.Content: very clean, lovely and comfortable bed. small bathroom but very up- to- date shower room. one thing that really irritated me was the location of the standing towel holder which made the towels touched the side of commode.walking distance to train station -this was a real plus because of the ridiculous cost of riding the taxi..very small elevator. friendly and helpful staff. did not get the chance to eat breakfast because of early departure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Doolin300
Reviews.Content: I Just want to warn people about this hotel. We got married in rome in November I have been wanting to write this review for so so long. It was a wonderful day etc everything went so so well. My cousin as a wedding present booked this hotel for us on the night of our wedding. We were so happy with the surprise etc until the night of the wedding. It was absoloutely terrible... the front staff were very rude and uninterested during the night we got a phonecall to our bedroom to be told to vacate the room as there was a problem with the credit card. The staff must have got all the details mixed up put some american guy on the telephone telling us were were staying using his card shouting down the phone at us. It was totally disasterous. The next morning the staff tried to pass the whole lot off. They were fighting amongst themselves with a big dog gone totally crazy inside the desk. Eventually we had to get the police to sort everything out. The staff were gone over the top one girl was crying as the owner was shouting at her. It was just unbelievable. I would not every stay in this hotel again. It was so unprofessional the way they handled the whole situation. We got absoloutely no satisfaction only people shouting and screaming at each other, we had to just walk out of the place. Please Beaware....

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: 1SwissMiss
Reviews.Content: I reserved two double rooms for my friends and I. I was at this hotel three nights and my friends 5. I thought my room was rather nice and thought we'd lucked out. My friends had a room that was a bit more beat up looking (the walls were scuffed) and looked out over an air vent that apparently smelled bad. My friends had a problem with the faucet and with their shower. The people in charge came straight away for the shower and my friends didn't tell them about the tap, so nothing was done (but that's our fault). They also had a problem with a spray air freshener thing. The management did not know how to turn it off and said it couldn't be done, but my friend found a way to do that. I think they found the room to be too expensive, but I think it's par for the course in Rome. My only personal comment is that I reserved the room with a credit card and they charged the card without asking me. I'd seen the reviews here and brought cash and would have prefered to pay that way. The location is ideal for airport arrivals. The train arrives 200m from the hotel, and that eliminates a lot of stress. It's about a 15-20 minute walk from the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickyk
Reviews.Content: We are 30 year old Male and Female couple and stayed at the Hotel Marghera. This was a Very well located as it is right next to Termini station and the service was really nice, breakfast was nice and staff were friendly. The use of Silver in the breakfast room was astounding. The staff at this hotel were friendly especially Paolo who was very helpful. Only critisism i had there was no bottle opener supplied with the mini fridge but its not life or death. If you stay at this hotel i am sure you will enjoy it even if it is only for a couple of days. Its Clean, friendly and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nordkvinnen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2006. We booked impulsively when passing, because we were very disappointed with the hotel we had at the time. Rooms are very nice; our room had a nice looking bed and a sofa. Large nice bathroom, but there was a leak in our bathroom. Water was leaking on the floor when we uses the shower, and by the mouldy smell it had probably been there for some time. Breakfast room was clean and nice looking, but the staff had a bit problems coping with all the guests - one morning there was no bread, no ham and no juice when we arrived, and it took some time before we got something to eat. But staff was very friendly. The hotel is close to Termini, and that was very convenient for us, because the taxi drivers were striking most of the time, so it was impossible to get a taxi. Nice hotel where I would gladly stay again, but in another room without water leaking at the bathroom and the mouldy smell from it!

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else if you can”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rude and uninterested front desk staff. Strange how the credit card machine broke the morning we had to checkout, meaning a dash to an ATM for cash. Beds were showing their age and the shower was so small that turning around was almost impossible. AC worked well enough. Only plus was its location: two blocks to Termini station. Not a terrible hotel, but would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel by Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: sas526
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just steps from side entrance to Roma Termini (turn right as you walk from platforms and exit station. you will be on the correct street. don't let the map fool you into thinking you should take the front entrance, you will have to double back.) Very clean, nicely decorated small hotel in Rome. Was not able to sample free breakfast since we had an early flight. We did have a short power failure (1-2 minutes, unfortunately while in shower:), but overall, would stay again. Cannot beat for convenenience to station & train to airport. Can also walk to the Forum, Spanish Steps, etc. Enjoyed!

HotelInfo.Name: Marghera Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marghera 29, 00185 Rome, Italy
